property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Multiple Staging Areas

property.name: Text
property.value:
In The Siege of Erebor, multiple staging areas are in play at the same time, with a quest stage assigned to each. Player card effects at one stage cannot affect any other stage.
At the beginning of the round, each player, starting with the first, chooses a quest stage to be that player's main quest until the end of the round. Multiple players may choose the same quest stage. If a player chooses a stage that is different from his choice in the previous round, return all enemies engaged with him (starting with the enemy with the lowest threat) to his previous stage's staging area.
Any encounter card effect that mentions the "quest stage" refers to the encounter quest card at that stage (2B, 3B, 4B, or 5B). Player side quests are played to the player's current staging area, and can still be chosen as the active quest by the first player in turn order at that stage during the quest phase.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor

property.name: Keywords
property.value: West and East

property.name: Text
property.value:
At the beginning of the game, the quest stages form a line starting at 2B, The Eastern Defences, on the right (east), and ending at 5B, Erebor, on the left (west). The term "eastmost quest stage" thus refers to the quest stage furthest to the right that is still in play. Each phase of the game is resolved simultaneously, starting with the eastmost quest stage (i.e. 2B fully resolves the combat phase, then 3B, the 4B, then 5B, then 2B resolves the refresh phase, etc.).
The Moves West (East) keyword represents cards moving from one stage to another. If a card Moves West (East), it is moved to the nearest staging area that is still in play to the left (right) of its current location, towards (away from) Erebor. Cards at the leftmost (rightmost) stage area are immune to Moves West (East).

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Invade X

property.name: Text
property.value:
During the staging step, players will not reveal cards from the encounter deck in the normal way. Instead, the first player triggers Invade X, where X is the number of players in the game plus 1.
The invade keyword represents the invading forces coming from the east. When the Invade X keyword is triggered, reveal X cards from the encounter deck as if they were revealed at the eastmost quest stage in play, with the exception of locations. If a location is revealed with a quest stage number indicated in the bottom right of the card, it is added to that quest stage's staging area. If that staging area is not in play, discard the location without resolving its When Revealed effects, and instead deal 2 damage to the eastmost quest stage in play.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Custom Set - The Siege of Erebor

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Adding a Quest Stage to the Victory Display

property.name: Text
property.value: After a quest stage is added to the victory display and its Forced effect has been resolved: 1) From lowest to highest engagement cost, each enemy in that stage's staging area moves west. 2) Discard each location at that quest stage from play. Then, raise the threat of each player in the game by the number of locations discarded. 3) Remove any other cards at that stage (such as objective allies or side quests) from the game. The staging area at that stage is no longer in play. 4) Each player at that stage immediately changes their main quest to the nearest quest stage to the west. Enemies engaged with a player remain engaged with that player (in contrast to changing quest stages at the beginning of the round). 5) Play resumes.
